article.text: 07/12/2011 - 07:58:46 Three men have been arrested by gardaí investigating last night's shooting in Dublin. Two men were injured in the incident which happened on Huband Road in the Bluebell area shortly after 11.15pm last night. The victims were taken to St James' Hospital for treatment. Their injuries are not believed to be life-threatening. The three suspects, aged 17, 21 and 33, are being questioned at Kevin Street, Kilmainham and Pearse Street garda stations. Gardaí have appealed for anyone who saw any suspicious activity in the area before or after the shooting to contact them. News alerts: Sign up here for our breaking news alerts by SMS
